bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Robert Dinwiddie was a British colonial administrator who served as lieutenant governor of colonial Virginia from 1751 to 1758. Dinwiddie's actions as lieutenant governor are commonly cited as precipitating the French and Indian War. In January 1758 he left Virginia and lived in England until his death at Clifton, Bristol.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A political and military letter in which Dinwiddie comments at length about the French and Indian War. He complains to Gov. DeLancey about the tardiness of his troops. Dinwiddie then comments on the Albany Plan.
